desc: Verify project setup & tooling: Confirm repo structure, Gradle sync, Compose preview works, Room/Firebase/Gemini libs resolve; create CONTRIBUTING.md with branch naming and PR checklist.
UserProfile + Room schema v1: Implement UserProfile, Restaurant, MenuCapture, MenuItem entities, DAOs, and type converters (lists/tags for allergies/dislikes/preferences).
Landing Screen: Branding display with Continue button, navigation to Login/Register flow.
Firebase Auth: Login screen with email/password, Register screen with name/email/password/confirm, password reset flow, create UserProfile in Room on registration.

Onboarding UI (language + tags): Language dropdown (French, German, Spanish, etc.), chip inputs for allergies (red), dislikes (yellow), preferences (green); validation (language required), save to Room.
Bottom navigation & nav graph: Tabs for Scan, Menu, Profile; back-stack behavior and deep-links for opening a saved menu by ID.
Image picker + camera permission: Import menu image from gallery, handle EXIF orientation, store image URI with restaurant name input.

Gemini API integration: Configure API client, construct multimodal request with menu image (Base64), user dietary profile JSON, structured prompt for extraction/translation/classification, handle response parsing.

Scanning Menu screen: Display menu image with animated magnifying glass (Compose animations), show processing state, handle success (navigate to Detailed Menu) or error (show message, return to Import).
Store Gemini response in Room: Parse JSON response, create MenuCapture (status: NEW → PARSED), create MenuItem entities with original/translated names/descriptions, risk levels, detected ingredients.
Early Gemini API test pass: Use 8–10 diverse menu fixtures (photo, scan, foreign language EN/FR/ES); log failures with example images, validate JSON response structure.
Risk classification validation: Implement deterministic Red/Yellow/Green logic with precedence (Red > Yellow > Green), unit tests with table-driven cases for allergens/diets/dislikes.

Detailed Menu screen: LazyColumn with cards showing dish name/description/price, color-coded tags (red/yellow/green), translated/original toggle, Menu Plus Suggestion section with reasoning, Delete button.
Live profile sync: When UserProfile changes, re-evaluate all saved MenuItem entities; update risk classifications; show recomputed toast on menu load.
Saved Menu screen: Grid layout with menu cards showing restaurant name, date, allergen count indicator (red outline with number); empty state message; click opens Detailed Menu.
Profile screen: Edit language dropdown, allergy/dislike/preference chip inputs (same UX as onboarding), prevent duplicates, save updates to Room, trigger profile sync on save.
Error taxonomy & UX: Map Gemini API errors (network, rate limit, parsing failures) to user-friendly messages; loading states with progress indicators; retry flows for failed scans.
Accessibility pass: Content descriptions for all interactive elements, focus order (keyboard nav), touch targets (48dp minimum), color+icon+text redundancy for risk indicators, contrast ratio checks.
Internal QA round: Re-evaluate saved menus after profile changes; test offline behavior (airplane mode); verify menu load time under 15s for 1-page menu on mid-range device.
Performance optimization: Image preprocessing (rotate/auto-contrast before Gemini upload), Room query tuning with indices, jank fixes on long menu lists (LazyColumn optimization).
Test fixtures & demo data: Curate final menu set (EN/FR/ES, fancy vs casual); Room seed script to load/delete fixtures quickly for demos.
Static analysis & CI: Add ktlint Gradle tasks; GitHub Action for build + lint on PRs; status badges in README.
Offline-first validation: Ensure saved menus viewable without network; Gemini API calls gracefully handle offline state; cached translations persist.
Final QA: Regression testing from earlier bugs; run through rubric checklist; confirm deterministic risk classification on repeated inputs; verify all must-have features functional.
Documentation & slides: Update README with architecture, screenshots, build instructions; Part A-D excerpts; record screen captures for main flows (onboarding → scan → detailed menu).
Release build & dry-run: Generate signed release APK; install on two physical devices; time full demo flow (target <15s menu load); rehearse presentation sequence.
Presentation & final polish: Demo checklist, backup device, extra APK on USB; finalize speaking parts; verify all screens work flawlessly.
